content.description:
Start in an inside corner and follow good holds up on the left onto the arete until you gain the ledge. The anchor is at the point of the triangular face ahead of you. Move right to the vertical dirty face and end with an awkward exit.

Descent: Rap/lower off or walk off up then scramble down right.
content.location:
Start in the corner 6'or so to the left of "Ramped Up"

Route 2 in the photo.

content.description:
Make your way up a blocky, unstable looking face before getting to the right leaning ledge/crack. The rocks on the start section seem to be more stable than they look, but double check your placements and beware of loose rock.

Once you work your way up the ledge and to the right, work through the small off-width, or around to the right to gain the large ledge below the vertical triangular face with the anchors at the tip. Head off to the left of the face and scramble up an easy face to the anchors.

Beware of rope drag for lower-offs and swings for TR on this one. You might want to leave a piece of gear in that diagonal ledge for a redirect.

Descent: Rap off or walk off up then scramble down right.
content.location:
Start is pretty obvious below the right leaning crack, it's the block dirty looking face right at a decent flat-ish area for a comfortable belay.

Route 1 in the photo.
